alert.note: Alert for Saginaw; Shiawassee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 8:55PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Saginaw and Shiawassee Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 854 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Ithaca to 6 miles northwest of Laingsburg to Lansing. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Laingsburg around 900 PM EDT. Marion Springs around 905 PM EDT. Merrill around 920 PM EDT. Owosso around 925 PM EDT. St. Charles and Henderson around 930 PM EDT. Corunna around 935 PM EDT. Perry and Oakley around 940 PM EDT. Freeland and Morrice around 945 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Brant, Nelson, Swan Creek, Garfield, Hemlock, Fenmore, Bennington, Shaftsburg, Shields and Carland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
